results.title: After the whale
results.creator_credit: L. Richard Ellison and Time-Life Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Around Us”.
Probably the most misunderstood animal, the whale is shown in this film to be a playful, shy, browsing mammal, defenceless against us and on the verge of extinction.

results.title: Lewis Mumford on the city
results.creator_credit: Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This series illustrates what Mumford first explained in his celebrated book ‘The City in History : its origins, its transformation and its prospects’. These films comprise an engrossing study of the city as it once was, the city as we know it now and the city as it may be if it survives the dangers which Mr. Mumford points out on the screen. Filmed in eleven countries, a master view is presented of the city, and the glories of city life with the achievements, failures and promises of our urban culture made plain. Throughout the films you feel the warm attachment to cities which underlies Mr. Mumford’s conviction that “the city is man’s most precious collective invention”. He asks and tries to answer: What has the city done to ennoble man in the past? What is it doing now to rob him of rewards that urban life should give him? Challenges all concerned about the way we live and about the legacy we leave to our children.

results.title: The City and the future
results.creator_credit: Guy Glover, Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Lewis Mumford on the city”.
Today an urgent choice must be made - an urban sprawl or a new kind of regional city. Examines prospects for the city and ways to restore its role as the focus of man’s highest achievement

results.title: The City as man's home
results.creator_credit: Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Lewis Mumford on the city”.
Slums, giant public housing complexes, mass suburbs, anonymous and bleak luxury apartments - almost everywhere in cities communal standards of living are falling even as personal standards of living rise. How did this happen and what can our cities do to improve communal living standards? These problems are discussed and fully illustrated.

results.title: The Heart of the city
results.creator_credit: Bryan Probyn, Claus Loof, Derek Knight, Erik Nielsen, Francois Seguillon, Hector Lemieux, Jacques Giraldeau, Jean-Claude Chiabaut, Kirk Jones, Leonard Forest, Mogens Gander, Reginald Morris, Terence Macartney-Filgate, Wim Smits, Ytzen Brusse, Guy Glover, Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Lewis Mumford on the city”.
A study of the growing sterility, dullness and congestion that is destroying the vitality, variety and breadth that once made cities physically attractive and humanly creative. Narration: Budd Knapp.

results.title: The City and it's regions
results.creator_credit: Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Lewis Mumford on the city”.
History shows that cities thrive best when they live in harmony and balance with the countryside around them. The film asks how this balance can be maintained or restored in today’s sprawling metropolitan regions.

results.title: The City: cars or people?
results.creator_credit: Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Lewis Mumford on the city”.
A study of an old but dangerously growing problem - how to make the city accessible without allowing transport to make it congested and uninhabitable, as the private car now threatens.

results.title: The City: heaven and hell
results.creator_credit: Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Lewis Mumford on the city”.
An outline of the opposed natures - creative and destructive - of the city in history, the elements that created the first cities about 5000 years ago, and the forces that now threaten to destroy them.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Let's Talk about It
results.brief_description: The first three programs in this series follow the experiences of an upper primary school class as they learn about human reproduction and sexuality. The final two programs discuss the experience with the teachers and parents.
